visualization.help:
### What is the Phylogenetic Tree Viewer?
The Phylogenetic Tree Viewer allows you to display and explore phylogenetic trees from Newick or NHX formatted files using the interactive [Phylocanvas.gl](https://phylocanvas.gl/) library.
After selecting a dataset, the tree will be rendered with options to change its layout, customize colors, and adjust node and label styles.
#### Key Features
- **Tree Layouts**: Choose among rectangular, circular, diagonal, radial, or hierarchical views. - **Node Shapes**: Customize leaf nodes with circles, squares, stars, or triangles. - **Color Customization**: Set colors for edges, nodes, and highlighted branches. - **Label Controls**: Show, hide, or align labels depending on your tree type. - **Interactive Navigation**: Zoom, pan, and select branches for closer inspection.
This tool is ideal for evolutionary biology, taxonomy, and anyone working with hierarchical data structures.
To learn more about Phylocanvas.gl, visit: [https://phylocanvas.gl/](https://phylocanvas.gl/)
